result.execSummary:
The defendant Quino A Ledesma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Matter may be expunged upon successful completion of sentence.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation. Must be 100% compliant.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care unless assessment from Wheaton is acceptable.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quino A Ledesma

Defendant Quino A Ledesma in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Amend Cts 1-3 to misd resisting, deft will plead to Cts 1-3 as amended and Ct 4 as charged. Joint recommendation - w/held sent-12 mos prob. Defense asks that the matter be expunged.
P-G to all four counts
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. Cts 2-4 - $200 & cc, no DNA costs. 6 mos to pay. FTP - 1 day for every $50 owed
                                    Ct 1 - 9 mos RCJ/STAYED, 2 yrs prob. May be expunged if deft successfully completes probation.

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
unless the assessment from Wheaton is acceptable

Status conference on May 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Quino A Ledesma in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defense requests additional status.  Additional information to be acquired.  Defense also requesting bond modification to remove GPS monitoring.  No objection by the State.
BTC: bond modified to allow GPS removal.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY ESMERELDA LEDESMA DOB 11/20/1977.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant, SLS.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to work, court, medical appointments and meeting w/his Atty. DEFENDANT MUST RESIDE W/MOTHER ESMERELDA LEDESMA.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 2-23-2016:  Defendant may attend AA and NA meetings.**

Defendant Quino A Ledesma in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Jennifer Tanck-Adams.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defense req bond mod.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod denied.
  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
